Key Arguments: Censorship regulations are concerning and complex.
No government or third party is capable of determining final truths.
Government itself spreads misinformation and lacks transparency.
Censorship is ineffective and prone to misuse.
Alternative solutions like promoting healthy debate and reducing algorithmic echo chambers are preferable.
Main Themes: Promotion of open debate and diverse perspectives
Criticism of algorithmic influence on information consumption
Notable Quotes: The concern is that if a third party body or government try and be the determining agent that decides what is misinformation, then we are heading for dangerous times.
It is impossible to use censorship as a way forward. It will be misused without a doubt.
Make sure we have room for healthy debate.
